IX.iii.1.J.1.n
.
Example 3:  Convertibility of Assets
Example
:  The Veteran has an Individual Retirement Account (IRA) worth $100,000 and is 53 years old.  If the Veteran withdraws any amount prior to age 59 and a half a 10 percent penalty will incur.
Result
:  Until the Veteran reaches age 59 and a half, only 90 percent of an IRA value should be counted as an asset.  In this example, the IRA is valued at $90,000.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section J - Net Worth, Asset Transfers, and Penalty Periods
citation: Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section J
